title: Hate crimes in New York City are up 76% this year compared to the same period in 2021
description: Hate crimes in New York City have increased 76% so far this year compared to the same period last year, according to data from the New York Police Department Hate Crimes Task Force (HCTF) released this week.

title: Jen Psaki says Fox News' questions make correspondent look 'stupid'
description: When asked about Fox correspondent Peter Doocy's questions, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki referenced a snide comment President Biden made on a hot mic earlier this year.

title: CBP officers discover bat meat in traveler's baggage at Washington Dulles Airport
description: US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers inspecting luggage at Washington Dulles International Airport recently discovered an unusual find: three and a half pounds of bat meat.

title: Tom Hanks reunites with 'Wilson' from 'Cast Away' while throwing first pitch in Cleveland
description: Wilsoooon!

title: Young Americans have turned on President Biden
description: Young Americans have turned on Joe Biden.

title: You can get Peeps-flavored ice cream delivered for free on Easter
description: Peep, peep: Springtime's favorite candy is back, now in the form of Peeps-flavored ice cream.

title: Ukraine braces for retribution after sinking of Russian flagship
description: The war in Ukraine could soon enter a new, even more dangerous phase.

title: Liverpool books ticket to FA Cup final after 3-2 win over Manchester City
description: A rampant Liverpool advanced to the FA Cup final on Saturday, beating Manchester City 3-2 at a sunny Wembley stadium.

title: Emma Raducanu hampered by blister in heavy Billie Jean King Cup defeat
description: Emma Raducanu said a blister "completely stopped" her from moving after suffering a heavy straight sets defeat in the Billie Jean King Cup qualifiers on Saturday.

title: You can now buy a Picasso from Ruth Bader Ginsburg's private collection
description: It's not just a screen print by the German artist Josef Albers.

title: See what happened when protester projected Ukraine's flag on Russian embassy
description: In a game of "cat and mouse," protestors projected the Ukrainian flag onto the Russian embassy's building in Washington, DC. The embassy responded by attempting to wash out the flag's image with a floodlight.

title: 86-year-old woman rescued in Ukraine after outpouring of support
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward gives an update on an 86-year-old woman who had been trapped in Ukraine but was able to evacuate after an outpouring of support.

title: Severe storms are possible this holiday weekend
description: Storm systems will make for a messy holiday weekend across most of the United States, with a soggy and stormy start to Passover -- with a risk of isolated tornadoes -- for many in the Southeast and Northeast, plus Easter eggs possibly covered in snow from Montana to Michigan.

title: Trae Young's second half blitz steers Hawks into NBA playoffs
description: An explosive second-half performance from Trae Young steered the Atlanta Hawks past the Cleveland Cavaliers, 107-101, and into the NBA playoffs on Friday.

title: China's Covid controls risk sparking crisis for the country -- and its leader Xi Jinping
description: • Beijing 'painfully aware' of economic fallout from lockdowns: European Chamber President

title: Travel news this week: Craigslist cruise ships and contraband canes
description: Easter Saturday: It's that sweet lull between the weekend travel crowds. If you're celebrating, we wish you a happy holiday season.

title: Experts are predicting a summer of travel chaos. Here's why
description: It's time! Travel restrictions are easing, infection rates are settling, you're fully vaccinated, and you're finally thinking about going on vacation. This is the year to make up for the holidays you didn't enjoy over the past two years. You've likely saved for two years to make it a good one. This -- finally -- is it.

title: Gun buybacks take weapons out of circulation, but experts say there's no evidence the programs reduce violence
description: Chicago officials launched a fundraising campaign to support the city's largest ever gun buyback program, with the goal of raising $1 million to entice people to turn in guns during two large events this year.

title: Autism is misunderstood. The 'We're Not Broken' author becomes a self-advocate to change that
description: Write about what you know. That's why Eric Garcia wrote his 2021 book, "We're Not Broken: Changing the Autism Conversation."

title: Could Macron really lose to Le Pen? All you need to know about the French election
description: It's Macron vs. Le Pen, round two.

title: Queen Elizabeth will not attend Easter Sunday service at Windsor, royal source says
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II will not join other members of the royal family for an Easter Sunday service at Windsor Castle this year, according to a royal source.

title: Biden's trademark political traits tested by war in Ukraine
description: When President Joe Biden labeled Russia's actions in Ukraine "genocide" this week, the response by his team looked much different than when he declared, also unplanned, that Vladimir Putin shouldn't be in power.

title: Surgery by mobile phone light and reusing catheters: Sri Lanka's economic woes push hospitals to the brink of disaster
description: Three-year-old Miru plays with a bright red toy car, seemingly oblivious to the crisis unfolding around him.

title: Zelensky says world should be prepared for possibility Putin could use nuclear weapons
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told CNN Friday that "all of the countries of the world" should be prepared for the possibility that Russian President Vladimir Putin could use tactical nuclear weapons in his war on Ukraine.
